alert.note: Alert for Iron; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 3:26PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dry wash and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Utah, including the following counties, Iron and Washington. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause dry wash and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Iron and Northern Washington Counties including Bench Road from Newcastle to Enterprise and SR-18 from Beryl Junction to Enterprise.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
